# Nicholas Reynolds
Lecturer (~Assistant Professor) in Economics, University of Essex

I received my PhD from Brown University in 2020.

I'm a labo(u)r and health economist. Much of my research focuses on the health and human capital of Americans and innovation.

## News

- [The Broad Decline in Health and Human Capital of Americans Born after 1947](https://www.aeaweb.org/articles?id=10.1257/aeri.20230588) was published as the lead article in *American Economic Review: Insights*.
- Figure 1 was selected as an [AEA Featured Chart](https://www.aeaweb.org/research/chart/american-health-capital-decline).
- I also wrote a related piece for [LSE Business Review](https://blogs.lse.ac.uk/businessreview/2025/10/21/what-caused-the-american-decline-of-the-past-60-years/).
- Commentary is available at [Marginal Revolution](https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/08/was-the-great-stagnation-originally-a-problem-of-human-capital.html) and [Bloomberg Opinion](https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2024-08-27/great-stagnation-when-did-it-actually-begin?utm_source=website&utm_medium=share&utm_campaign=twitter&sref=htOHjx5Y).
